intro: Calycadenia spicata, commonly known as the spiny goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its narrow, spiny leaves and yellowish flowers are adaptations to its arid environment. Calycadenia spicata is often found in regions with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
